data.text:
@AmandaLynGunn @DrVidSiva How is code-switching relevant? 

We're at a WORK lunch, she tells us she was in a research study about COVID-19, says there was "pop rocks" after study, is asked what that is, & response (to a man) is pop rocks are the best way to give oral sex & she knows from recent experience
@AmandaLynGunn @daph_ling @DrVidSiva I can't imagine in what realm this would fall under "code switching".
@daph_ling Like, not wrong about the fact, but horrendous company to announce it in.

@PhageHunterKW @DrVidSiva My labmate was equally stunned and we chatted about it. 

Upon reflection, it seems the shock factor causing stunned silence is *one* way in which grad students who make inappropriate comments become faculty who make inappropriate comments. Nobody ever calls them out on it.

@DrVidSiva Right? There was just complete silence at the table. So she added "it's from recent experience."

How do you even respond to someone who does that?
